task.title: Installing and configuring an NTP master server

context.p: Use this procedure to configure an NTP master server on a master host node.
context.note: On VMware vSphere guests, disable time synchronization between guest and host operating systems before performing this procedure.

step.cmd: Log in to the master host node .
Stop and disable chronyd, if present.

stepxmp.codeblock: test "$(systemctl is-active chronyd)" = "active" \ && systemctl stop chronyd && systemctl disable chronyd

step.cmd: Create a backup of the NTP configuration file.

substep.cmd: Replace all of the lines in the file with the following lines:

stepxmp.codeblock:
# Use the local clock server 127.127.1.0 prefer fudge 127.127.1.0 stratum 10 driftfile /var/lib/ntp/drift broadcastdelay 0.008
# Give localhost full access rights restrict 127.0.0.1
# Grant access to client hosts restrict ADDRESS_RANGE mask NETMASK nomodify notrap

substep.cmd: Replace ADDRESS_RANGE with the range of IPv4 network addresses that are allowed to query this NTP server.

stepxmp.p: For example, the following IP addresses are assigned to hosts: 203.0.113.10 203.0.113.11 203.0.113.12 203.0.113.13
For the preceding addresses, the value for ADDRESS_RANGE is 203.0.113.0.

substep.cmd: Replace NETMASK with the IPv4 network mask that corresponds with the address range.
substep.stepxmp: For example, a valid network mask for 203.0.113.0 is 255.255.255.0.

substep.cmd: Save the file and exit the editor.
Enable and start the ntpd service.

stepxmp.codeblock: systemctl enable ntpd && systemctl start ntpd
